intro: Grielum humifusum, commonly known as the groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are usually basal, with a rough texture and a distinctive yellowish-green color. Grielum humifusum produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer.
